content.description:
Quam legis, a rapta BriseideBriseis, Briseidos, f.: Briseis (a woman’s name) littera venit, 
vix bene barbaricabarbaricus, -a, -um, adj. = alienus, -a, -um GraecaGraecus, -a, -um, adj.: Greek notatanoto, -are, -avi, -atum = scribo, -ere manu.
content.question: In the sentence, what does littera mean?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
